case_title: Raja KHALID GULZAR And Others vs SECRETARY COLONIES, BOARD OF REVENUE, GOVERNMENT OF THE PUNJAB And Others
respondant: Secretary Colonies, Board of Revenue, Government of the Punjab and Others
complaint_summary: The petitioners challenged the termination of their lease for land allotted under Animal Breeding Conditions by the Ministry of Defence after the expiry of the lease period.
investigation_summary: The case involved the termination of lease by the Ministry of Defence and subsequent orders by the Board of Revenue and District Collector. Petitioners argued for renewal of lease based on performance and alleged procedural lapses in termination.
judgment_summary: The court remanded the case to the District Officer (Revenue)/District Collector, Sargodha, directing him to decide afresh within a month, applying his mind to the facts and circumstances of the lease termination and ensuring compliance with legal provisions.
Decision_or_verdict: Remanded to District Officer (Revenue)/District Collector for reconsideration.
legal_arguments: Petitioners argued that their performance during the lease period was in accordance with the terms of the grant.
Petitioners contended that the District Officer (Revenue) failed to provide proper hearing as directed by the High Court.
Petitioners claimed a right to renewal of lease based on performance and procedural lapses in termination.
assets: Land allotted under Animal Breeding Conditions
key_issues: Termination of lease without proper notice.
Renewal of lease based on performance.
Compliance with legal procedures in lease termination.

maxims.Status Quo: Maintained until the case is decided afresh.

legal_terms.Superdari: Temporary custody or management of property.

words_and_phrases.Lease Termination: End of lease period as per agreement.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the termination of land leases allotted under Animal Breeding Conditions by the Ministry of Defence. Petitioners challenged the termination citing procedural lapses and sought renewal based on performance. The court remanded the case for reconsideration, emphasizing compliance with legal provisions and proper notice requirements.
